title: Can't play League because it says d3dx9_39.dll is missing
body:
http://i.imgur.com/MLhXb8K.png[/img]

The launcher's fine. It just fucks up after champ select ends and the game tries to launch.

Tried googling it. Just a bunch of people saying to download the runtime. Downloaded and ran the runtime. Install location bar was blank. Had no idea what folder to put it in. 
http://i.imgur.com/bEwPb5u.png[/img]

Also tried googling where DirectX should be installed, to which people were just saying "it should be automatically installed." Decided to post here. This was my first game of a 5 minute low-prio, and now I'm probably going to go up to 10 minutes.

replies.body:
Heyo,

You need to re-install a base version of DirectX and associated runtimes. That picture you have is asking where you want the DirectX source files to be installed to be unpacked to. Pick a folder somewhere you remember, and is ideally empty. Then click OK. When it's done, navigate to that folder and run the file 'DXSETUP' in it, that'll auto-install and update DirectX.

Then restart your computer once it's finished. That should fix it. Should it not, you'll want to install the DirectX runtimes from a different source, such as a required installation from a different video game (since we don't have DirectX as part of the main installation from the core files).
Can confirm. Had the same problem and had to reinstall Directx
Wait why did I post it here? They don't look at these. The most recent Red response was on a post 4 days ago lmao
